summary: Research completed on purely syntactic representation theorem. Found that the current approach correctly uses MCS for representation theorem but has issues in finite model construction. Recommended filtration-based approach to separate completeness (infinite canonical model) from decidability (finite model property).

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive research report with analysis of current implementation, historical approaches, canonical model theory, algebraic methods, and recommendations for filtration-based purely syntactic approach

key_findings: Current representation theorem is already purely syntactic
Problem lies in finite model construction, not representation
Filtration is the recommended approach for FMP
Truth bridge between finite and general validity needs filtration
Algebraic methods provide alternative approach via Lindenbaum-Tarski algebras
